name: Freie Universität Berlin
goal: Freie Universität Berlin is one of the eleven universities to have been successful in all three lines of funding in the government's Excellence Initiative in 2012. It is well-known for its future development strategy of an 'International Network University'. With more than 150 different academic programmes in a broad range of disciplines, it is a full-spectrum university.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: H2020, FP 9; EU Research and Innovation Funding Policies; EU Higher Education Policy, Erasmus +
